results.name: Least m>0 for which m*n^2 + 1 is a square.
comment: Least m>0 for which x^2 - m*y^2 = 1 has a solution with y = n.
For n > 1, a(n) <= n^2-2. - _Chai Wah Wu_, Jan 26 2016
link: T. D. Noe and Chai Wah Wu, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000 n=1..500 from T. D. Noe
formula: For n a power of an odd prime, a(n)=n^2-2. For n twice a power of an odd prime, a(n)=(n/2)^2-1. - T. D. Noe, Sep 13 2007
mathematica: a[n_] := For[m=1, True, m++, If[IntegerQ[Sqrt[m*n^2+1]], Return[m]]]; Table[a[n], {n, 100}]
